Description: Fragment of neck and oval handle to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 148 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Ink '5', not deleted Name Pythogenes. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0200.24.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (232)
